result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent C. Dodson II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Information [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previusly provided).**Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  May Not have contact with anyone under age of 18 unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Comply with requirements of Sex Offender Registry; Not to use  computer and /or internet w/o approval of the agent.  Not to be present on premises of K-Mart Store in Kenosha.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Deft. is sentenced to 3 years and 6 months in WSP; 1 year & 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Sentence is concurrent to 14CM710, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Deft. is eligible for CIP & SAP.
Due to a continued jury trial; Sentencing moved to 11/13/14 at 2:30 PM per confirmation with Atty Watson
Sentencing hearing on November 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Date changed from 11/14/14 at 10:30 on the Court's own motion.

Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 11/14/14 at 10:30.  Bond continued.  D.A. to writ def. from RCI.
Final pre-trial on October 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Due to continued jury trial; FPT rescheduled to 10/3/14 at 8:30 AM per confirmation with Atty Watson.
